alert.note: Alert for Southern Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 18 at 9:49PM EST until November 19 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow occurring. Additional accumulations of less than one inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 or more inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Southern Erie county. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight EST tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult at times due to poor visibility in falling snow and slick, snow-covered roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect a burst of heavy lake effect snow late Saturday evening with a cold frontal passage, with bands of locally heavy snow continuing into the day Sunday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
